acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.6mg/L of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (HSDB, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of > 5,000mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 700mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC (1987).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since the acute toxicity was Category 1 and it had no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), and it had the bio-accumulation (BCF=709 (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2003)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo studies and no positive data on in vitro mutagenicity tests (several indices), described in NTP DB (Access on June 2006) and IARC 30 (1983).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine), with the oxygen and chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (RTECS (2006)): "Mildly irritating to the eye."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (exposure duration unknown) (RTECS (2006)): "Mildly irritating to the skin."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "tonic-clonic epilepsy" (HSDB (2003)), and the evidence from animal studies including "moderate to severe anemia; extramedullary hematopoiesis of the liver and spleen and erythroid hyperplasia of the bone marrow" (IRIS (2003)), "depression with salivation, lacrimation, diarrhea, and deep rapid respiration" (HSDB (2003)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "ataxia, mild excitement/confusion" (IARC (1983)), and the evidence from animal studies including "ataxia, lacrimation, wheeze, laboured breathing and coma" (IARC 30 (1983)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
